availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Rankin. Father of Sarah Rankin, Thomas Rankin, Mary Rankin, and Henry Rankin. Stepfather of John Lyter, Alonzo Lyter, and Jonas Lyter. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Served in the Harrison County Home Guards (U.S.A.). Died at the Battle of Cynthiana on July 17, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 481.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 110B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0511.
